vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἔρῑθος, ὁ, ἡ,
day-labourer, hired servant; of mowers or reapers, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; later ἔριθοι, αἱ, spinsters and weavers, workers in wool (probably because popularly derived from ἔριον), [Refs 4th c.BC+]; of spiders, πάντα δ᾽ ἐρίθων ἀραχνᾶν βρίθει [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II metaphorically, servant, minister, τλήμων γαστρὸς ἔριθος, = crepitus ventris, [Refs]; Ἔρις..Νίκης κασιγνήτη καὶ ἔ. Timo 21.2; ὕπνον νυκτὸς ἔ. Epic.Anon.in [Refs]
vocabInfos.shortDef: wool worker; one working in wool
